ns:common.topic.description: thinBasic is a BASIC-like computer programming language interpreter with a central core engine architecture surrounded by many specialized modules. Although originally designed mainly for computer automation, thanks to its modular structure it can be used for wide range of tasks.
rdfs:label: thinBasic

ns:common.document.text:
thinBasic is a BASIC-like computer programming language interpreter with a central core engine architecture surrounded by many specialized modules. Although originally designed mainly for computer automation, thanks to its modular structure it can be used for wide range of tasks.
ThinBASIC supports wide range of numeric and string data types.
Besides those mentioned in the table above, programmer can define pointers, user defined types and unions.
The special features related to user defined types in ThinBASIC are:
Variables can be defined in global, local or static scope. ThinBASIC supports arrays of up to 3 dimensions.
ThinBASIC is being installed with modules. Each module is dedicated to specific area of interest.
To use a module, programmer just has to write:

Language can be enhanced by module development using SDK for many languages ( PowerBASIC, FreeBASIC, C, MASM ).
